title: About ICA Political Communication Summer School
text:
About ICA Political Communication Summer School




The Lectures
The School addresses the main theoretical and empirical questions at the intersection of political communication, political science, and political sociology, with a special focus on the relationship between political communication, media, political participation and democracy.


The Faculty
The 2026 Faculty gathers internationally renowned academics to engage with students. Confirmed in-person speakers include: Dr. Christian Baden (The Hebrew University of Jerusalem), Dr. Dam Hee Kim (Korea University), Dr. Regina Lawrence (University of Oregon), Dr. Joerg Matthes (University of Vienna), Dr. Patricia Moy (University of Washington), Dr. Chris Fei Shen (City University of Hong Kong), Dr. Lone Sorensen (University of Leeds), Dr. Talia Stroud (University of Texas at Austin), Dr. Sebastián Valenzuela (Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile), Dr. Claes de Vreese (University of Amsterdam).


The Students
Participants come from around the globe; countries represented at previous Summer Schools include USA, Canada, Colombia, Brazil, UK, Norway, Sweden, Finland, Latvia, Russia, Poland, Germany, The Netherlands, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Serbia, Turkey, Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa among others.












A Successful Experience
Building on the experience of the last 15 years, the 2024 Summer School offers a unique opportunity for 30 PhD candidates and early career academics in communication, sociology, psychology and political science:

To attend an intensive, six-day program that consists of lectures, master classes, paper presentations and mentoring sessions, and

to build long-lasting personal and scholarly relations in a celebrated friendly and productive environment.

title: ICA Polcomm Summer School
text:
Sponsorship Details
satRday is committed to being an affordable and open conference for all interested R users. To provide highly discounted tickets, we plan to raise $10,000 with sponsors this year.
Sponsorship price is $1,000 and includes:

Three (3) individual registrations (a $50 value)
Your organization’s logo displayed on the conference website and at the beginning of each talk
An optional 5-minute slot at the conference where you may talk about how you use R in your organization

Sponsors will benefit from direct access to one of the main organizers to address any questions or extra requests.

title: Call for submissions
text:
Call for submissions




Call for submissions
The Political Communication Division of the International Communication Association (ICA) calls for applications for its co-organized 9th edition of the International Summer School in Political Communication that will be held 13-17 July 2026 at the Devonshire Hall, University of Leeds (UK).
The ICA Political Communication Summer School addresses theoretical and empirical questions at the intersection of political communication, political science, and political sociology, with a special focus on the impact of communication factors, from television to the new digital media, on electoral participation, political attitudes, and voting behavior. This year’s theme is: “Political Communication and Democratic Ideals”.
Building on the experience of the last 17 years, the 2026 Summer School offers a unique opportunity for 30 PhD candidates and early-career academics in communication, sociology, psychology and political science:

to attend an intensive, six-day program that consists of lectures, master classes, paper presentations and mentoring sessions, and
to build long-lasting personal and scholarly relations in a celebrated friendly and productive environment.

Participation will be on a competitive basis. Candidates interested in applying to the ICA Summer School should submit a three-page research proposal or an extended abstract of a research paper on issues broadly related to political communication. Submissions should include the name, email address, institutional affiliation, a brief bio (max. 200 words) mentioning main research interests and ongoing projects, and a recommendation letter. An international selection committee will review the applications.


Key Dates and Fees

Application deadline: 1st March

Enrollment fee: £550 (covers accommodation).
